ConditionType

The possible types for conditions.

Similar to variable but constructed from a domain directly wihout specifying its type.

Logical disjunction of conditions.

Build a comparator for membership: item in container.

flatten(...)

Flatten a nested iterable domain into individual items while preserving the parent bindings.

A universal on variable that finds all sets of variable bindings (values) that satisfy the condition for every

A universal on variable that finds all sets of variable bindings (values) that satisfy the condition for any

krrood.entity_query_language.entity.ConditionType#

The possible types for conditions.

krrood.entity_query_language.entity.entity(selected_variable: krrood.entity_query_language.utils.T) → krrood.entity_query_language.symbolic.Entity[krrood.entity_query_language.utils.T]#

Create an entity descriptor for a selected variable.

Parameters:

selected_variable – The variable to select in the result.

Returns:

Entity descriptor.

krrood.entity_query_language.entity.set_of(*selected_variables: typing_extensions.Union[krrood.entity_query_language.symbolic.Selectable[krrood.entity_query_language.utils.T], typing_extensions.Any]) → krrood.entity_query_language.symbolic.SetOf#

Create a set descriptor for the selected variables.

Parameters:

selected_variables – The variables to select in the result set.

Returns:

Set descriptor.

krrood.entity_query_language.entity.variable(type_: typing_extensions.Type[krrood.entity_query_language.utils.T], domain: krrood.entity_query_language.symbolic.DomainType, name: typing_extensions.Optional[str] = None, inferred: bool = False) → typing_extensions.Union[krrood.entity_query_language.utils.T, krrood.entity_query_language.symbolic.Selectable[krrood.entity_query_language.utils.T]]#

Declare a symbolic variable that can be used inside queries.

Filters the domain to elements that are instances of T.

Warning

If no domain is provided, and the type_ is a Symbol type, then the domain will be inferred from the SymbolGraph,

which may contain unnecessarily many elements.

Parameters:

  • type – The type of variable.

  • domain –

    Iterable of potential values for the variable or None. If None, the domain will be inferred from the SymbolGraph for Symbol types, else should not be evaluated by EQL

    but by another evaluator (e.g., EQL To SQL converter in Ormatic).

  • name – The variable name, only required for pretty printing.

  • inferred – Whether the variable is inferred or not.

Returns:

A Variable that can be queried for.

krrood.entity_query_language.entity.variable_from(domain: krrood.entity_query_language.symbolic.DomainType, name: typing_extensions.Optional[str] = None) → typing_extensions.Union[krrood.entity_query_language.utils.T, krrood.entity_query_language.symbolic.Selectable[krrood.entity_query_language.utils.T]]#

Similar to variable but constructed from a domain directly wihout specifying its type.

Logical conjunction of conditions.

Parameters:

conditions (SymbolicExpression | bool) – One or more conditions to combine.

Returns:

An AND operator joining the conditions.

Return type:

SymbolicExpression

Logical disjunction of conditions.

Parameters:

conditions (SymbolicExpression | bool) – One or more conditions to combine.

Returns:

An OR operator joining the conditions.

Return type:

SymbolicExpression

krrood.entity_query_language.entity.not_(operand: ConditionType) → krrood.entity_query_language.symbolic.SymbolicExpression#

A symbolic NOT operation that can be used to negate symbolic expressions.

krrood.entity_query_language.entity.contains(container: typing_extensions.Union[typing_extensions.Iterable, krrood.entity_query_language.symbolic.CanBehaveLikeAVariable[krrood.entity_query_language.utils.T]], item: typing_extensions.Any) → krrood.entity_query_language.symbolic.Comparator#

Check whether a container contains an item.

Parameters:

  • container – The container expression.

  • item – The item to look for.

Returns:

A comparator expression equivalent to item in container.

Return type:

SymbolicExpression

krrood.entity_query_language.entity.in_(item: typing_extensions.Any, container: typing_extensions.Union[typing_extensions.Iterable, krrood.entity_query_language.symbolic.CanBehaveLikeAVariable[krrood.entity_query_language.utils.T]])#

Build a comparator for membership: item in container.

Parameters:

  • item – The candidate item.

  • container – The container expression.

Returns:

Comparator expression for membership.

Return type:

Comparator

krrood.entity_query_language.entity.flatten(var: typing_extensions.Union[krrood.entity_query_language.symbolic.CanBehaveLikeAVariable[krrood.entity_query_language.utils.T], typing_extensions.Iterable[krrood.entity_query_language.utils.T]]) → typing_extensions.Union[krrood.entity_query_language.symbolic.CanBehaveLikeAVariable[krrood.entity_query_language.utils.T], krrood.entity_query_language.utils.T]#

Flatten a nested iterable domain into individual items while preserving the parent bindings. This returns a DomainMapping that, when evaluated, yields one solution per inner element (similar to SQL UNNEST), keeping existing variable bindings intact.

krrood.entity_query_language.entity.for_all(universal_variable: typing_extensions.Union[krrood.entity_query_language.symbolic.CanBehaveLikeAVariable[krrood.entity_query_language.utils.T], krrood.entity_query_language.utils.T], condition: ConditionType)#
A universal on variable that finds all sets of variable bindings (values) that satisfy the condition for every

value of the universal_variable.

Parameters:

  • universal_variable – The universal on variable that the condition must satisfy for all its values.

  • condition – A SymbolicExpression or bool representing a condition that must be satisfied.

Returns:

A SymbolicExpression that can be evaluated producing every set that satisfies the condition.

krrood.entity_query_language.entity.exists(universal_variable: typing_extensions.Union[krrood.entity_query_language.symbolic.CanBehaveLikeAVariable[krrood.entity_query_language.utils.T], krrood.entity_query_language.utils.T], condition: ConditionType)#
A universal on variable that finds all sets of variable bindings (values) that satisfy the condition for any

value of the universal_variable.

Parameters:

  • universal_variable – The universal on variable that the condition must satisfy for any of its values.

  • condition – A SymbolicExpression or bool representing a condition that must be satisfied.

Returns:

A SymbolicExpression that can be evaluated producing every set that satisfies the condition.

krrood.entity_query_language.entity.inference(type_: typing_extensions.Type[krrood.entity_query_language.utils.T]) → typing_extensions.Union[typing_extensions.Type[krrood.entity_query_language.utils.T], typing_extensions.Callable[[typing_extensions.Any], krrood.entity_query_language.symbolic.Variable[krrood.entity_query_language.utils.T]]]#

This returns a factory function that creates a new variable of the given type and takes keyword arguments for the type constructor.

Parameters:

type – The type of the variable (i.e., The class you want to instantiate).

Returns:

The factory function for creating a new variable.
